msItem.rubric: Incipit opusculum de ratione spere ex summorum disciplinis philosophorum cum labore & diligentia excerptum
msItem.incipit: Quicumque mundane spere rationem et astrorum legem seu stellarum in ea existentium nosse desiderat
msItem.title: Astrological treatise ('Opusculum de ratione spere')
msItem.note: Extracts, chiefly from the prologue, pr. D. Juste, Les Alchandreana primitifs (Leiden, 2007), pp. 268-71, to illustrate this text's use of Alchandrean texts. Otherwise unprinted; contents summarized in Thorndike, History of Magic and Experimental Science, I, 707-9; Blume et al., Sternbilder des Mittelalters, I.396-400; and see ibid, I.397, for other manuscripts of the text (including MS. Bodl. 614).

msItem.author: Adelbold of Utrecht
msItem.title: Sententia ad Gerbertum, De crassitudine spere
msItem.incipit: Domino summo pontifici et philosopho Girberto pape Athelwoldus vite felicitatem et felicitatis perpertuitatem
Macrobius super somnium Scipionis ubi loquitur de magnitudine celi
msItem.explicit: in puteorum profunditatibus et altitudinibus edificiorum idem inuenitur
msItem.note: Pr. N. Bubnov, Gerberti opera mathematica (1889), 302-9, text here approximately corresponding to 302.9-10, 303.19-309.21 (profunditatibus); after 306.15 'crassitudine' follow eight lines apparently not in the printed text, 'Si quis uult inuenire quadraturam circuli ... et sic inueniet circuli quadraturam'.

decoNote.p: Fine miniatures (drawings, partly coloured), good diagrams, initials. (P&A iii. 196, pl. XIX)

decoDesc.decoNote: Other initials in red and green (e.g. fols. 1-14v, 17r-29r); blue and red with penwork decoration (fols. 15v-16r); blue and red (e.g. fols. 29v-32r); some initials and rubrication unfinished; instructions to the rubricator in the outer margins, often cropped (e.g. fol. 32r-v)
Astrological miniatures, fols. 44r-49r, 50v-56r, 57r-58v, 62r-66r, 67r (fully described in Blume et al., Sternbilder des Mittelalters, I.400-2)
Space left for diagram on fol. 76r.

history.provenance: Chronological note, fol. 37r, referring to the year 1417.
'2o fo. greci vero - v s.' (fol. iii verso, 15th century, second half)
'Sachent tous que messer L'mans de. ..ues (?) a pris | ....... wicresse (??) sus .. lune .iij. f.aas ... | apres lascencion lan lxx' (15th century, fol. 78r)
'A boke of astronomy' (fol. ii recto, c. 1500)
Notes and scribbles, partly illegible, 16th century, fol. 77r (upsidedown): 'To my very frinde Ind', 'Emkin Highe' (??)

'Roberte Colshill', 16th century, second half (fol. ii recto), with motto (?) 'qui ne ay ne peult' (not in M. P. Siddons, A dictionary of mottoes in England and Wales (2014)). Pen-trials and notes in the same (?) hand, fol. 77r: 'thinke and thank god' [cf. Siddons, Mottoes 230], 'Elizabeth dei gratia Angl. Franc.', 'Euer lastinge mortall God', 'et habeat corpus eius coram'. In the same (?) hand, fol. 78r, 'Elizabeth dei gratia Angliae Franciae et Hiberniae regina fidei defensor vic. London' salutem precipimus vobis quod exigi fac.'
Thomas Allen, '15' (fol. 1), no. 15 in his catalogue of 1622.
Kenelm Digby; bequeathed to him by Allen in 1632.
history.acquisition: Donated by Digby to the Bodleian in 1634.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted (2017) from W. D. Macray, Bodleian Library Quarto Catalogues IX: Digby Manuscripts, repr. with addenda by R. W. Hunt and A. G. Watson, 1999.
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 89-90 Quarto Catalogue (addenda), p. 44 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 72
